Player History
Signed as a free agent by St. Louis on 4/3/1985 to a 1-year deal worth $2,280,000 per year...
Had first career hit on 4/3/1985, off Eric Show (SD)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/3/1985, off Eric Show (SD)...
Injured on 4/12/1985 with a Inflamed Hip Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Injured on 9/7/1985 with a Inflamed Elbow Ligament, out for 1-2 weeks...
Traded from St. Louis to Seattle on 2/8/1986 (Going to SEA: 3B Paul Molitor. Going to STL: CF Ivan Calderon, P Chuck Cary, P Randy O'Neal, SS Spike Owen)...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Kansas City on 5/11/1987...
Won Player of the Week award on 8/7/1987, hitting .586 with 1 HR, 5 RBI...
6/24/1988: Signed a contract extension with Seattle, $2,750,000 per year, for 2 years.
Had 6 hits with 2 RBI against Oakland on 7/6/1988...
Was selected to the 1989 Allstar game...
Won Batter of the Month award on 8/1/1989, hitting .386 with 3 HR, 29 RBI...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/4/1989, hitting .500 with 1 HR, 5 RBI...
Had 5 hits with 4 RBI against Boston on 6/26/1990...
Was selected to the 1990 Allstar game...
Signed as a free agent by Seattle on 2/7/1991 to a 1-year deal worth $1,788,800 per year...
